excellent.text: Maya, I can see you're feeling really frustrated with that puzzle. That's okay - puzzles can be tricky! I noticed you got three pieces to fit perfectly. Would you like to try finding one more piece that fits, or would you like to take a break and come back to it later?
excellent.description: Includes emotion labeling, validation, scaffolding, and choice offering

moderate.text: Maya, puzzles can be hard sometimes. Don't worry about it. Let's try to find the corner pieces first and build from there. You're doing great and I know you can do this!
moderate.description: Some validation and scaffolding but lacks explicit emotion labeling

poor.text: Maya, stop being upset. Big kids don't cry over puzzles. You need to try harder and focus better. Just put the pieces together like I showed you before.
poor.description: Lacks empathy, dismisses emotions, uses developmentally inappropriate language

minimal_length.text: That's okay Maya. Puzzles are hard. Let's try again. You can do it. I believe in you. Keep trying.

special_characters.text: Maya, I see you're frustrated! üòî That's totally normal - puzzles can be super tricky sometimes! üß© I noticed you got those corner pieces to fit perfectly. üëç Would you like to try finding one more piece, or take a little break? ü§î

very_long.text: Maya, I can see that you are feeling really frustrated with this puzzle right now, and that's completely okay and normal - puzzles can definitely be very tricky and challenging, especially when we've been working on them for a while. I want you to know that your feelings are valid and it's perfectly fine to feel upset when something is difficult. I noticed that you were able to get three pieces to fit together perfectly, which shows that you have really good puzzle-solving skills and you were being very persistent. Would you like to try working on just one more piece together with me, or would you prefer to take a little break from the puzzle and come back to it later when you're feeling ready? Either choice is completely fine with me.
very_long.description: Very long response to test system limits

successful_analysis.scenario_context: During free play time, 4-year-old Maya is working on a 12-piece puzzle. She has been trying for 5 minutes and is showing signs of frustration.
successful_analysis.audio_transcript: Maya: "This is stupid! I can't do it!" *pushes puzzle pieces away*

evidence_metrics.name: Emotion labeling and validation
evidence_metrics.description: Explicitly acknowledging and naming child's emotions

malformed_request.test_purpose: Validate error handling for malformed requests
